intro: Claytonia parvifolia var. adsurgens, commonly known as the erect or ascending Claytonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent-like leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its stems are upright and often branched, giving it a compact, mat-like appearance. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in rocky garden settings.
